title: PSG reignite Lookman interest
body_text:
Paris Saint-Germain have reignited their interest in Atalanta forward Ademola Lookman as the French giants look to bolster their attack in the January transfer window.
The Parisians’ attack has struggled to score goals in recent matches, prompting the club to revisit their pursuit of the Nigeria international.
Lookman, 26, has been in scintillating form since joining Atalanta from RB Leipzig in 2022 for €9.35m plus bonuses, amassing 33 goals and providing 20 assists in 81 competitive appearances for the Italian side.
Last season, Lookman featured in 45 matches, weighing in with 17 goals and 10 assists. His standout moment came in the UEFA Europa League final against Bayer Leverkusen, where he netted a stunning hat-trick to secure the trophy for Atalanta.
The Nigerian’s performances have not gone unnoticed, with several top European clubs, including Manchester City, Liverpool, and Juventus, reportedly showing interest during the 2025 summer transfer window.
According to Fichajes, Atalanta have set an asking price of between €65m and €75m for Lookman, a figure likely intended to deter potential suitors in January.
The Serie A club are currently competing in the UEFA Champions League and battling for European positions for next season.
During the summer chase, PSG’s previous offer of between €25 and €30m, including bonuses, fell far short of Atalanta’s €50m valuation, as reported by TuttoAtalanta last month.
Lookman’s stock has risen further following his recent Player of the Match performance in Atalanta’s impressive 3-0 victory against Shakhtar Donetsk in the UEFA Champions League.
The forward scored one goal and provided an assist in the match, becoming only the second Atalanta player to achieve this feat in a single Champions League game.
Affectionately known as “The King of Bergamo” by Atalanta fans, Lookman’s consistent performances have also put him in contention for the 2024 African Player of the Year award.
As PSG continue to monitor Lookman’s situation, it remains to be seen whether the French champions will meet Atalanta’s valuation or if the Italian club will stay firm in their desire to retain their prized asset.
With the January transfer window approaching, football fans will be keenly watching to see if Lookman makes a high-profile move to the French capital or continues to live his Atalanta dreams.
